result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Hundley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Interfering/obstructing officers. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Hundley in court with attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to amend Count 1 to an ordinance DC and Count 2 to an interfering/obstructing.
Plea - Cts 1&2 - NC.
BTC: Cts 1&2 - GUILTY.    Cts 3&4 - DRI.
Count 1 -
$50+cc, 60 dtp, ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.

Count 2 -
$50+cc, 60 dtp, ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***12-14-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE SCRAM UNIT, DEFT TO CONTINUE RANDOM TESTING AND TESTING AFTER EACH COURT APPEARANCE.***  No contact with the victim TEH (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael J Hundley in court with attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on Def's Motion to modify bond.
Def moves to modify conditions of bond to remove the SCRAM unit.
State does not object.
BTC: Motion to modify conditions of bond granted, modify bond to remove the SCRAM unit, all other conditions remain.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Hundley

Prior: 6527 Hillwood Ct, Racine, WI 53406

Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense has filed an authorization to the Court.
Deft is not present today.
Deft is in counseling.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing.
Deft will finish counseling in January.
State does not object to the warrant being stayed until next court date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
